class lib.classes.games.connect_four.ConnectFourButton(y, emoji)Â¶

Bases: discord.ui.Button[ConnectFour]

Represents a UI button.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters

  • style (discord.ButtonStyle) â€“ The style of the button.

  • custom_id (Optional[str]) â€“ The ID of the button that gets received during an interaction. If this button is for a URL, it does not have a custom ID.

  • url (Optional[str]) â€“ The URL this button sends you to.

  • disabled (bool) â€“ Whether the button is disabled or not.

  • label (Optional[str]) â€“ The label of the button, if any.

  • emoji (Optional[Union[PartialEmoji, Emoji, str]]) â€“ The emoji of the button, if available.

  • row (Optional[int]) â€“ The relative row this button belongs to. A Discord component can only have 5 rows. By default, items are arranged automatically into those 5 rows. If youâ€™d like to control the relative positioning of the row then passing an index is advised. For example, row=1 will show up before row=2. Defaults to None, which is automatic ordering. The row number must be between 0 and 4 (i.e. zero indexed).

  • y (int) â€“

await callback(self, interaction)Â¶

|coro|

The callback associated with this UI item.

This can be overridden by subclasses.

Parameters

interaction (Interaction) â€“ The interaction that triggered this UI item.

  • row (Optional[int]) â€“ The relative row this button belongs to. A Discord component can only have 5 rows. By default, items are arranged automatically into those 5 rows. If youâ€™d like to control the relative positioning of the row then passing an index is advised. For example, row=1 will show up before row=2. Defaults to None, which is automatic ordering. The row number must be between 0 and 4 (i.e. zero indexed).

await interaction_check(self, interaction)Â¶

|coro|

A callback that is called when an interaction happens within the view that checks whether the view should process item callbacks for the interaction.

This is useful to override if, for example, you want to ensure that the interaction author is a given user.

The default implementation of this returns True.

Note

If an exception occurs within the body then the check is considered a failure and on_error() is called.

Parameters

interaction (Interaction) â€“ The interaction that occurred.

Returns

Whether the view childrenâ€™s callbacks should be called.

Return type

bool

Return type
